glsa.title: Vinagre: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A format string error in Vinagre may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Vinagre is a VNC Client for the GNOME Desktop.

description.p: Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) reported a format string error in the vinagre_utils_show_error() function in src/vinagre-utils.c.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user into opening a specially crafted .vnc file or connecting to a malicious server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Vinagre users should upgrade to the latest version:
